summary: 17 CFR § 230.501 provides definitions for terms used in Regulation D, particularly focusing on the criteria for being classified as an "accredited investor." This includes various entities such as banks, investment companies, and individuals with a net worth exceeding $1 million or income exceeding $200,000 (or $300,000 jointly with a spouse) in the last two years. The section also outlines exceptions and additional qualifications for accredited investor status.
